1. Contents

This zip/installer contains the following files:

FILENAME: DESCRIPTION:
Release notes PS2Tuner.htm This file
ps2tuner.exe Tuner application
ps2tuner.chm Tuner help file
snTuner.h User markers header file
snTuner.lib User markers library
PS2Tuner_UG.pdf Tuner user guide
ps2tm.exe Target Manager application
ps2tm.chm Target Manager help file
demangle.dll Demangle DLL
GnuSrc.txt GNU licensing information
COPYING.LIB LGPL

 The LGPL only applies to the demangle.dll file.

2. What's New

New Features since V1.2.2

  • Fill/Circular buffer support - allows capture of > 64K frames (specify buffer size on Load Elf dialog)
  • New source/disassembly pane allowing viewing of disassembly of functions where source is not available
  • Source View now contains tabbed source files.
  • Enhanced Function Instrumenting - now all child functions can be instrumented
  • New and simple to use function patching dialog
  • Command line support for loading datasets
  • Persistence of common settings including view orientation and sync-to-gameview
  • No longer requires sntuner.irx

3.Compatibility

This version is compatible with the Sony 2.8.0 runtime libraries.

4. Installation

If you are installing from the zip, extract the zip file to your ProDG for PlayStation2 installation directory (usually C:\Program Files\ProDG for PlayStation2). Remember to preserve the directory hierarchy from the zip file.

The Tuner and Target Manager applications require an SN Systems license key file to activate them. Apply to sales@snsys.com for a license or look here (www.snsys.com/Sales/licensing.htm) for more details.

6. Limitations

  • Do not use the following in your source code:
    - sceSifRebootIOP() (it currently unloads the Tuner communication driver).
    - Performance counters.
    - Do not change CPU Timer (Coprocessor 0 Count - Register 9).
  • If you use a gcc3 series compiler then be aware that functions with no parameters are mangled with open and close brackets. This may cause your sync function not to be found if you enter its name manually. To overcome this, always select the function name using the list of all available functions.
  • No support for functions in DLLs, this will be provided in a later release.
  • Developers should be aware that when triggering large volumes of small DMA transfers (e.g. to/from SPR) the results presented by the Tuner maybe misleading, this is irrespective of whether the DMA activity is captured or not.
  • Instrumented Functions have the following limitations:
    - It is not possible to instrument a sync function's ascendant, i.e. a function that calls a sync function or a function that calls a function that calls a sync function.
    - Instrumented Functions can generate significantly more data which can sometimes result in frames being truncated when the buffer limit is exceeded. To avoid frame truncation use the fill/circular buffer capture method described in the manual.

7. Support

First line support for all SN Systems products is provided by the Support area of our website. To view these pages you must be a registered user with an SN Systems User ID and Password. If you have forgotten your User ID/Password, visit www.snsys.com/errors/password/searcher.asp

Once you have a valid User ID and Password you can visit our website Support area at:

www.snsys.com/support (English)

www.snsys.jp/support (Japanese)

If the answer to your problem cannot be found on the website, you can e-mail our support team at:

support@snsys.com (English)

j-support@snsys.com (Japanese)
